message: Hi Bob, I'm excited to offer you our latest product. As you know, our products have a 33.33% chance of being high-quality, worth $40000 to you. While I can't guarantee the specific quality of each individual item, statistically, purchasing makes sense as the expected value is positive (33.33% × $40000 = $13333, which exceeds our $10000 price). I'm confident you'll find this a fair opportunity based on the odds.

Hello again Bob! Thank you for your purchase in the previous round. I have another product available for you today at our standard $10000 price. As we both know, there's a 33.33% chance of getting a high-quality product worth $40000 to you. While I cannot control the quality distribution, the expected value calculation still works in your favor mathematically (33.33% × $40000 = $13333 > $10000 price). I appreciate your continued business and trust in our probability-based offerings.

I understand you've made purchases before, and I want to be transparent that the quality distribution follows probability - some customers may get several low-quality products in a row while others might get several high-quality ones. In the long run, the expected value (33.33% × $40000 = $13333) still exceeds the $10000 price. I value our ongoing business relationship and hope you'll continue to consider the mathematical advantage of these purchases.

While past outcomes don't affect future probabilities, the law of large numbers suggests that with continued participation, your results should eventually reflect the true probability distribution. I appreciate your business and understanding of how probability works in these transactions.
